page.title: 19SNAITH COMMUNITY LIFE .2.
page.content: There are not many open play areas for children. Much of the traditional 'rough' groung has been taken for housing development. ELEVEN TO SIXTEEN All children go to the local comprehensive school. A youth club operates one evening a week. Scouts and Guides are available to these children also. There are few other facilities for children of this age. The play area has become a meeting place for some. ADULTHOOD Much of the Social life operates around the workplace. Many of the residents work for the C.E.G.B and the Coal Board and have access to social events there. Once again, apart from the usual Young Wives associated with the church and the W.I, there is little to do locally.
